newsitem.title: GREECE: PASOK WILL GO AHEAD WITH LONG-TERM CONTRACTS - MIN.
newsitem.headline: PASOK WILL GO AHEAD WITH LONG-TERM CONTRACTS - MIN.

text.p: Greek Development Minister Vasso Papandreou said the socialist government will go ahead and sign long-term procurement contracts with Greek firms after the elections, Flash radio station said.
Papandreou made the statement while visiting the headquarters of state telecom OTE, the radio said.
She blasted former conservative National Economy Minister Stefanos Manos for favouring open international tenders for public procurements.
OTE is looking into the possibility of exercising an option in its 1994 contract with Intracom and Siemens Hellas to order an additional 300,000 digital switches.
Greek prosecutors have laid criminal and misdemeanor charges against unknown individuals in connection with the 1994 deal. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
